teaser: President Obama is expected to nominate Jack Lew to replace Timothy Geithner as Secretary of the Treasury today. Lew is currently the White House chief of staff and has a reputation as a tough negotiator. Supermarkets and pharmacies in Australia are reporting a shortage of baby formula -- it turns out Chinese customers are stockpiling the formula. And, how confident are you about our economic future? Your answer may have more to do with politics and economics.
title: Marketplace Morning Report for Thursday, January 10, 2013
byline: Jim Burress, Mark Garrison, David Gura, Phil Mercer, Eve Troeh, Frank Newport, Sam Beard and Jeff Horwich
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Thursday, January 10, 2013
description: President Obama is expected to nominate Jack Lew to replace Timothy Geithner as Secretary of the Treasury today. Lew is currently the White House chief of staff and has a reputation as a tough negotiator. Supermarkets and pharmacies in Australia are reporting a shortage of baby formula -- it turns out Chinese customers are stockpiling the formula. And, how confident are you about our economic future? Your answer may have more to do with politics and economics.
